bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records related to various Villanova University alumni/alumnae. Materials include news clippings, obituaries, memoirs, articles, tickets, identification cards, school papers, laboratory reports, and grade reports. A number of the items relate to Joseph P. Barrett, including biographical information; correspondence; manuscripts of Barrett's Good Luck to Him Now: a World War II Memoir (1995) and The Maverick Outfit: 474th A.A. Battalion (1966); and an article by Barrett about the influx of veterans at Villanova in 1946. The collection also includes a copy of Michael Patrick Connolly's The Wildcats: A History of Villanovans in Professional Sports, 2005; a manuscript of We Build a Road to Tokyo, a memoir of the Seabees in World War II by Henry J. Rumbarger; and a series of letters home from school written by William P. Lemmer, 1947-1948.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
